TopicTitle: but are the Building at KSP#2 destructable?

Articles.Content: Probably not, you can't pan the camera round to view them

Most likely, AFAIK they are the same buildings put into a different place. I heard that haivng osmething on the other launch pad affects the normal one, so they are just copies. As long as they updated the buildings from the very old ones to the newish ones, then they are.
Doubt it. How would you repair them?
I have no interest in repairing them. I just want to make ICMB's launched from KPS #1 to blow it up.
Just go try it, probably not though.

Most likely, AFAIK they are the same buildings put into a different place. I heard that haivng osmething on the other launch pad affects the normal one, so they are just copies. As long as they updated the buildings from the very old ones to the newish ones, then they are.

You'll have to go try to find out, but I wanted to clarify that they are not the same buildings as are at the KSC. They are more relics of an earlier KSP time.
Here is something a little easier, see if the island buildings are destructible. If they aren't, then it's almost certain KSP2 aren't either.
good point, Alshain, and yes, that is MUCH easier

You'll have to go try to find out, but I wanted to clarify that they are not the same buildings as are at the KSC. They are more relics of an earlier KSP time.

Aww, I thought they are clones of the others. I heard that the launchpads interfere with each other, but that's probably outdated by now :/
Nope, island base isn't, Kofeyh found that for us.
